reasoning.correctness: Gold Answer accurately captures symptom onset one week ago (P-1, P-2), initial stuffiness (P-3), shift to runny (P-3), decongestant influence (P-10), initial 'on and off' (P-1) clarified to 'pretty constant' (P-8), and lack of improvement (P-1). Generated Answer correctly notes week duration and progression from stuffy to runny but uses incorrect citations (D-3/D-4 instead of P-3) and falsely claims no information on constant/intermittent despite direct patient response in P-8 ('pretty constant'), contradicting Gold and introducing significant factual error.
reasoning.completeness: Gold key points: 1-week onset, stuffy first, shift to runny, decongestant role, 'on and off' to constant clarification, no improvement. Generated covers onset duration (~20%), first symptom, predominant change (~50% total), but entirely misses constant/intermittent pattern, decongestants, and improvement status (covers ~50-60%).
reasoning.faithfulness: Claims on duration and progression grounded in P-2/P-3, but citations inaccurate (D-3/D-4 refer to doctor questions, not patient answers); major hallucination/misread: asserts no answer to D-8 on constant/intermittent when P-8 explicitly states 'pretty constant for the past week', introducing unverifiable false claim.
reasoning.relevance: Directly addresses core question elements (onset, first symptom, predominant change) but evades constant/intermittent by wrongly claiming absent; no off-topic content, remains focused on nasal symptoms.

summary: The Generated Answer partially captures symptom progression but contains significant factual errors, incorrect citations, and hallucinates absence of key information on symptom constancy, leading to incomplete and unfaithful evaluation.
